trans-unit.source: Represents a grammar element that contains phrases or other entities that a user can speak to produce a successful recognition.

An <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> object can consist of phrases, entities such as <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef> objects, logical combinations of phrases and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef> objects, and so on.

You can use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.Elements%2A> property on the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> class to gain access to the constituents of an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> object.

The order in which <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> objects appear in a given <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule> object specifies the order in which a user must speak them.
By default, the contents of an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> must be spoken exactly once.

To specify that the contents of an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> must be spoken repeatedly, use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor and set the `repeatCount` parameter.

Similarly, to specify a range for the number of times that an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> can be spoken, create the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> with one of the constructors that set the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MaxRepeat%2A> property and the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MinRepeat%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> already exists, you can use one of the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A> methods to specify repeats.
You can also specify the probability that an item will be repeatedly spoken by setting the value of the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.RepeatProbability%2A> property.

<xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> objects within an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsOneOf> object comprise a list of alternatives from which the user can speak one.
You can use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.Weight%2A> property to specify the likelihood that a given item in the list will be spoken.

The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> class represents the `item` element that is defined in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201761).
For information about the SRGS `item` element and details about its support by System.Speech, see [item Element](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/10cba7dd-994e-4aa7-907e-0669e5467d60).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> class and specifies the number of times that its contents must be spoken.

This constructor sets <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MaxRepeat%2A> and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MinRepeat%2A> properties of the new <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> to the value in `repeatCount`.
The number of times that the item must be spoken.
repeatCount is negative or is larger than 255.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> class and specifies an array of <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsElement"></xref> objects to add to this instance.
The array of objects to add to the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> instance.
elements is `null`.
Any member of the elements array is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> class and specifies its textual contents.
The text associated with the item.
text is `null`.
text is an empty string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> class and specifies minimum and maximum repetition counts.
The minimum number of times that the text in the item must be repeated.
The maximum number of times that the text in the item can be repeated.
min is negative or larger than 255.
max is negative or larger than 255.
min is larger than max.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> class, specifies an array of <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsElement"></xref> objects to add to this instance, and sets minimum and maximum repetition counts.
The minimum number of times that the contents of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> object must be repeated.
The maximum number of times that the contents of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> object can be repeated.
The array of objects to add to the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> instance.
elements is `null`.
Any member of the elements array is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> class, specifies the text associated with the item, and specifies minimum and maximum repetition counts.
The minimum number of times that the item must be repeated.
The maximum number of times that the item can be repeated.
The text associated with the item.
min is negative or larger than 255.
max is negative or larger than 255.
min is larger than max.
Adds an object to the collection of objects contained in this <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.Add%2A> method appends an element to the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.Elements%2A> property.
The object to add.
element is `null`.
Gets the collection of objects contained by the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> instance.
The collection of objects contained by the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> instance.
Gets the maximum number of times that a user can speak the contents of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref>.
To set this property, use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A> method.

This property represents a portion of the `repeat` attribute defined by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0](http://www.w3.org/TR/speech-grammar/).
The maximum number of times that a user can speak the contents of the item.
Gets the minimum number of times that a user must speak the contents of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref>.
To set this property, use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A> method.
This property represents a portion of the `repeat` attribute of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS).
The minimum number of times that a user can speak the contents of the item.
Gets or sets the probability that a user will repeat the contents of this <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> instance.

The property applies only to items whose <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MinRepeat%2A> and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MaxRepeat%2A> properties have been explicitly set to non-default values, either by a constructor for <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem>or by the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A> method.
The probability, as a floating point value, that the contents of this item will be repeatedly spoken.
An attempt is made to set <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.RepeatProbability"></xref> to a value that is negative or larger than 1.0.
Sets the number of times that the contents of an <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> must be spoken.
This method sets the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MaxRepeat%2A> and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MinRepeat%2A> properties to the value in `count`.
The number of times that the item must be spoken.
count is less than 0 or greater than 255.
Sets the minimum number of times and the maximum number of times that an item can be spoken.
The minimum number of times that the item must be spoken.
The maximum number of times that the item can be spoken.
minRepeat is less than zero or larger than 255.
maxRepeat is less than zero or larger than 255.
minRepeat is larger than maxRepeat.

Gets or sets a multiplying factor that adjusts the likelihood that an <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem"></xref> in a <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsOneOf"></xref> object will be spoken.
The default value of this property is 1.0, which is equivalent to no weighting of the item.
A weight greater than 1.0 positively biases the likelihood that the item will be spoken, and a weight less than 1.0 negatively biases the likelihood that the item will be spoken.

This property is relevant only to <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> objects within an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsOneOf> instance; it is ignored in all other cases.
A floating point value that adjusts the likelihood of this item being spoken.
An attempt is made to set <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.Weight"></xref> to a negative value.
